issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
The log like following appeared every other time(1h~several days). After four months, the mq didn't work anymore.

fields.environment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.2

comments.body:
maybe post your connection pool configuration; the exception says it is closed, the question is why.

Does the pool expire connections or do checks before returning.

there is nothing here that points to a bug yet. The mail list is a better place to work through problems.

Hi Gary, here is the connection pool configuration:

<persistenceAdapter>
 <jdbcPersistenceAdapter dataDirectory="${activemq.base}/data" dataSource="#derby-ds"/>
 </persistenceAdapter>

...

<bean id="derby-ds" class="org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource" destroy-method="close">
 <property name="driverClassName" value="oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver"/>
 <property name="url" value="jdbc:oracle:thin:@xxx.xxx.com.cn:1521/orcl"/>
 <property name="username" value="******"/>
 <property name="password" value="******"/>
 <property name="maxActive" value="200"/>
 <property name="poolPreparedStatements" value="true"/>
</bean>
